metadata.title: CVE-2018-5182 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
If a text string that happens to be a filename in the operating system'snative format is dragged and dropped onto the addressbar the specifiedlocal file will be opened. This is contrary to policy and is what wouldhappen if the string were the equivalent "file:" URL. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 60.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5182` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
